title.value:
Optimal Extragradient-Based Algorithms for
Stochastic Variational Inequalities with
Separable Structure
title.justification: This is the title as it appears at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote:
Optimal Extragradient-Based Algorithms for
Stochastic Variational Inequalities with
Separable Structure

extractions.description: The paper explores the problem of solving stochastic monotone variational inequalities with a separable structure using a stochastic first-order oracle. The authors propose a novel algorithm called stochastic accelerated gradient-extragradient (AG-EG) for strongly monotone variational inequalities. The algorithm combines the strengths of extragradient methods and Nesterov acceleration to achieve an optimal convergence rate.

type.justification: The paper proposes a novel algorithm (AG-EG) and provides experimental results to demonstrate its performance and compare it with existing methods.
type.quote: We propose a class of algorithms named stochastic accelerated gradient-extragradient (AG-EG), which combine Nesterov acceleration with the extragradient method.

name.justification: The study revolves around solving optimization problems, specifically variational inequalities with a separable structure.
name.quote: We consider the problem of solving stochastic monotone variational inequalities with a separable structure using a stochastic first-order oracle.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on variational inequalities, particularly in the stochastic and monotone settings.
name.quote: We propose a novel algorithm—stochastic accelerated gradient-extragradient (AG-EG)—for strongly monotone variational inequalities (VIs).

name.justification: Since the proposed algorithm is designed to handle stochastic settings using stochastic first-order oracles, stochastic optimization is a key sub-field.
name.quote: We consider the stochastic setting where we can only access... through their unbiased estimators.

name.justification: This is the primary model introduced and studied in the paper.
name.quote: We propose a novel algorithm—stochastic accelerated gradient-extragradient (AG-EG)—for strongly monotone variational inequalities (VIs).

is_contributed.justification: AG-EG is the novel algorithm proposed by the authors in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a class of algorithms named stochastic accelerated gradient-extragradient (AG-EG).

is_executed.justification: The model is executed for empirical evaluation in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We provide empirical results demonstrating the performance of AG-EG.

is_compared.justification: The performance of AG-EG is compared with other algorithms in the literature for solving VIs.
is_compared.quote: Our algorithm achieves convergence rates that match the lower bounds... thus providing a unified optimal solution.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title for the novel AG-EG algorithm is not applicable as it is introduced in this paper.
